title: Valentine intro overlay with rose petals + playful evasive No, and copy tweak

requirements.summary: Replace all user-facing occurrences of “I love you” with “I like you” (hero copy and rotating one-liners).
acceptanceCriteria: The hero paragraph in App content no longer contains “I love you” and uses “I like you” instead.
The rotating one-liners list no longer contains “I love you” and uses “I like you” instead.
A search across the frontend source for the exact string “I love you” returns no user-facing occurrences (case-sensitive match).

file_operations.description: Update hero user-facing paragraph copy to replace the exact phrase “I love you” with “I like you”, keeping all text in English.
Update rotating one-liners array to replace the exact phrase “I love you” with “I like you”, ensuring no remaining case-sensitive user-facing occurrences.

requirements.summary: Add a full-screen intro overlay with rose petal animation and “Will you be my Valentine?” prompt that gates the existing wishing page content until “Yes”.
acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, the intro overlay is shown instead of the wishing page content.
The intro overlay includes a full-screen rose petal animation (petals visible across the screen).
The intro overlay displays the exact question text: “Will you be my Valentine?”
There are two visible buttons labeled “Yes” and “No”.
Clicking “Yes” dismisses the intro overlay and reveals the existing wishing page content.

file_operations.description: Create a full-screen modal-style overlay component that renders the exact prompt text “Will you be my Valentine?” and “Yes”/“No” buttons, and exposes an onAccept handler that dismisses the overlay when “Yes” is clicked. Use shadcn-ui patterns for accessible button styling where appropriate (without editing frontend/src/components/ui). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a presentational component that renders a full-screen rose petal animation layer (CSS/emoji-based, no backend-served images) suitable for use inside the intro overlay, with a reduced-motion aware rendering mode. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire the intro overlay into the existing Valentine wishing page so that, on initial load, the overlay is shown and the existing content is gated behind it; clicking “Yes” reveals the existing content without requiring persistence across reloads.
Add CSS keyframes/utilities to support the rose petal full-screen animation layer (petals across the screen), and ensure the styles respect prefers-reduced-motion for animation reduction.

requirements.summary: Make the “No” button playfully evade clicks while staying within the viewport and supporting reduced-motion accessibility.
acceptanceCriteria: Attempting to click/tap the “No” button causes it to reposition away from the pointer/finger before the click is registered, preventing a successful “No” click.
The evasive behavior stays within the viewport (button never becomes unreachable off-screen).
When `prefers-reduced-motion: reduce` is enabled, the rose petal animation and the evasive motion are disabled or significantly reduced, and the UI remains usable.

file_operations.description: Implement evasive “No” button behavior using pointer/touch event handling that moves the button before click registration; clamp the button position so it remains reachable within the viewport; and disable or significantly reduce the evasive motion when prefers-reduced-motion is enabled. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure the rose petal animation layer is disabled or significantly reduced when prefers-reduced-motion is enabled (to satisfy reduced-motion requirements alongside the evasive button behavior). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add/adjust CSS classes supporting the evasive button positioning/transition (and reduced-motion overrides) so movement can be smooth by default but minimized under prefers-reduced-motion.
